MERCHANT.Definition: someone whose job is to sell products, a shopkeeper

OUT OF CHOICE.Definition: because they chose to do it

NOODLE.Definition: a narrow, long strip of food made from flour or rice

PUN.Definition: humorous use of a word that has several meanings

GRIDDLE.Definition: a round, flat piece of metal used for cooking

PORCELAIN.Definition: a hard, shiny, white substance used for making pottery and decorations

NOVELTY.Definition: the quality of being new and unusual, innovation

CAPTIVATED.Definition: attracted and held their interest and attention

INNOVATION.Definition: new idea or way of doing things

NATIONWIDE.Definition: existing in all parts of the country

SHOOK.Definition: shocked, had a great effect on

A STROKE OF GENIUS.Definition: a very clever and original idea

ASSEMBLY LINE.Definition: a series or line of workers and machines

OFFERING.Definition: something that was offered or presented

BOOM TIME.Definition: a time of development and progress

STOPPING OFF.Definition: paying a short visit while travelling

PERSUADED.Definition: made them do it by giving them good reasons

FRANCHISING.Definition: that involves selling the right to sell their products to other businesses

NEGOTIATOR.Definition: one who arranges business by discussion

REGARDLESS.Definition: without being affected by, in spite

CREATURES OF HABIT.Definition: following routine, used to their own habits

DRIVING OFF.Definition: leaving in their cars, driving away

REVOLVES AROUND.Definition: has it as a main interest

A MATCH MADE IN HEAVEN.Definition: perfect combination, things that were perfect for each other

KICK OUR ADDICTION.Definition: overcome or free ourselves from this habit
